103369 referenced above, but does NOT contain a fix for this bug.

Hi Richard, can you look at this?
Reducing priority to reflect that this won't be addressed in time for WTP 0.7.

Problem is in WSDLModelAdapter.createDefinition(Element).
When the wsdl file is empty, we're not creating the Definition object.  We 
should be creating an 'empty' Definition object in this scenario.
A second problem arises when an 'empty' Definition object is created.  The 
Element passed into WSDLModelAdapter.createDefinition(Element) is null (in this 
scenario), however we try to retrieve the location value from this Element.  
Thus, the location value for the Definition is null.

I got the same 'internal error' creating a new wsdl and also opening a 
perfectly good (non-empty) wsdl.  I'm using Eclipse Version 3.1.1 (Build id 
M20050929-0840) and used the instructions from 
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/development/updatesite/updatesite.html to 
install WTP 0.7 on Windows XP with JRE 1.5.0_02.  

The detailed traceback trying to open a good wsdl is as follows:

OK, all my problems were fixed by reinstalling a fresh Eclipse 3.1.1 and 
updating to WTP 0.7.1 using the instructions from 
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/development/updatesite/updatesite.html, except 
that to see WTP 0.7.1 I had to uncheck "Show the latest version of this 
feature only" at step 6.
Problem appears to be fixed in the latest wtp driver.
